answers.answer: Take care of your sugar it DEPENDS ON YOU don't say tour diabetes I have it I'm 39 weeks 3 days and I won't be induced because I fallow my diet. Is up to you the future of your baby

Yes I know but I was diagnosed with gd when I was 29 weeks and didn't get the referral to the specialist till I was 32 weeks. I kept pushing my clinic and they just kept giving me run arounds. I did ask on here what can I do meanwhile to help myself and most mommies were very helpful with diet tips and all but at the end no matter what I got treatment too late. Thanks for the comment though.

Good luck Lizzie_Campos hope Everything works out for the best for you and hope you give birth to a healthy baby! I don't know to much about GD never had it.. but I have 4 kids pregnant with #5 and had all mine early. One at 35wks three at 36wks all healthy thank God :) but again best wishes for you & baby!

@jessilynn5 thank you so much for your words hun. I didnt know too much either and thought I was doing fine with my diet but turned out I actually needed some sugar in there. I had cut back on all sugar before i seen the dr. Still very confused about it but I'm gonna do the impossible for my baby to be born good and healthy.  Thanks again

I, too, have GD but was told that I'm getting induced at 39 weeks (in 3 weeks) regardless on following the diet. I'm sorry that you are going through this, but we must think positive, not negative (stillborn). If you ever want to talk, I'm here, mama. :)

Oh wow gd luck I believe u and baby will be fine just watch what u eat.. and my son was born 34 weeks he was great healthy so dont stress do the necessary things doctors ask.. and soon baby will be here gd luck

Aww candy thank you so much. So regardless of your diet you couldn't control it? Or why are you being induced? I've heard sadly a lot of mommies no matter what can't control it. I sure wish I would of known the week I was diagnosed what to do exactly to help myself bc now I feel guilty I could of done more. Regardless now I'm gonna do even more and yes stay positive. Thank you for always being such a sweetheart hun and good luck to you.
Think calming thoughts and do your best to relax. Gl! Hope everything goes well and everyone comes out healthy :)

Head up honey! The extra monitoring is to make sure baby can stay in as long as possible. I go between 2-3 times a week for checks and the NST is a breeze they just put two straps on your tummy and listen to the heart beat for 20-30 minutes just to make sure all is okay. I wish you and baby the best!

Lizzie, it's standard for my OB to induce at 39 weeks if you've been diagnosed with GD. I also have my NST appts weekly to make sure lil man is doing fine and the fluids are good. That's one perk.....seeing your baby every week. :)
Thank you ladies for your comments and support. I feel much better.

question: So had my Dr appt today and wasn't very good. Didn't hear what I wanted to hear. My diabetes is out of control so much he will def induce me at 38 weeks if not before. I have to now go twice a week with my ob and with the specialist so I can get monitored and they can see if maybe I will need to be induced before. I also have to go to the hospital Wed for an nst and other tests he's asking for. Its a bitter sweet ordeal. On one hand I will have my baby here in less then 4 weeks possibly and on the other we may have complications like him being born still born. :'( .
title: Being induced @ 38 weeks maybe sooner :(
